extendedInfo.description: The reality of college football is that teams go into every season knowing they'll never play the vast majority of other schools out there. So how can you ever begin to compare two teams that may or may not even play each other? The answer is by looking at common opponents and the results of those games.NCAA Football Head To Head allows you to matchup any two FBS schools in a "Six Degrees of Kevin Bacon" meets the greatness that is College Football. Find out if two teams like Auburn and Oregon play each other, whether they have some common opponent or opponents that they both play against or even if there's a connection where a team like Auburn played Alabama who played Tennessee who played Oregon. All with just a few simple touches of the screen.Features:-use any of the 120 FBS schools to show Head To Head results-2011 season schedule-weekly updates so your can use the prior week's scores to help compare teams-up to two degrees of separation when looking for common opponents-share via Facebook and Twitter

reviews.title: Very Helpful
reviews.comment: It does in seconds what takes me hours to do. Nice job.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Sorry needs update
reviews.comment: I did Ksu  vs Oklahoma and Oklahoma won
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Cool idea!
reviews.comment: I can\'t tell you how often I find myself digging through ESPN looking for this information and spending hours cross-referencing schedules! Based on the screenshots it should be really cool once the season kicks off and we start seeing some game results (just dates right now). With that said, theres a couple of things I\'d like to see. I\'d like to be able to see a team\'s full schedule and it would be awesome if we could see more details about individual games and perhaps link off to ESPN for box scores.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: This app does nothing and tells you nothing!! What a joke!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Never updates
reviews.comment: The concept is good but the app never gets updated. Today it still does not have games updated from November. Would be very useful if they updated.
reviews.author: Rob Riggs
